intro: Pentaphragma prostratum, commonly known as the prostrate pentaphragma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that lie flat on the ground. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists studying tropical flora.
